text: "Build a komainu decoration at the shrine!" said the order to all areas of Japan, back in the Edo Period. But the local stone carvers just thought, "What's a komainu?" They had never seen one before. There were no internet image searches, no fax machines. So those stone carvers did what they could: they used their imagination to create what they imagined a traditional komainu to look like. The result is known as Hajime-Komainu, or the "first komainu"! They look real funky!! Try doing an image search for them!

TRANSLATION NOTE:
MOVING FORWARD, "ANIMAL KINGDOM PIRATES" WILL NOW BE TRANSLATED AS "BEASTS PIRATES."
APOLOGIES FOR ANY INCONVENIENCE THIS MAY CAUSE, AND FOR NOT MAKING THIS DECISION EARLIER.
